trial_identification.studytitle: Effects of common sleeping pills on arousal and muscle function during sleep
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effects of common sedatives on respiratory arousal and upper airway muscle function during sleep in healthy men and women with and without sleep apnoea

interventions.interventions: Arm 1: temazepam (10mg), once only immediately before going to bed, taken orally Arm 2 zopiclone (7.5mg), once only immediately before going to bed, taken orally Arm 3: zolpidem (10mg), once only immediately before going to bed, taken orally 1 week washout between treatments
interventions.comparator: Placebo, taken orally (participants will act as thier own controls in a cross-over design)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Respiratory arousal threshold (negative pharyngeal pressure immediately prior to arousal from sleep using an epiglottic pressure catheter inserted via the nostril)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Acute overnight studies on drug vs. placebo

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Acute overnight studies on drug vs. placebo

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Healthy men and women with and without sleep apnoea
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: -Known allergy or previous adverse reaction to temazepam, zopiclone or zolpidem -Medications known to affect muscle activity or sleep -Pregnant or nursing mothers

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this physiology study is to examine the effects of common sleeping pills (sedatives) on the awakening (arousal) response to respiratory stimuli during sleep and their effects on upper airway muscles, airway function, and breathing responses during sleep.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Carberry JC, Fisher LP, Grunstein RR, Gandevia SC, McKenzie DK, Butler JE, Eckert DJ. Effects of Hypnotics on the Phenotypic Causes of Obstructive Sleep Apnea. Am J Respir Crit Care Med 2017; 195: A7531 [abstract to be presented at ATS, May 2017].
